description: Learn client-side routing in Svelte using popular libraries like Svelte Navigator or svelte-routing.

slides.title: Routing in Svelte
slides.content:
# No Native Router ü§∑

Core Svelte does NOT include a router (unlike Angular or Vue).

Options:
1.  **SvelteKit:** The official app framework (Filesystem routing).
2.  **Svelte Navigator:** Popular client-side router (like React Router).
3.  **svelte-routing:** Another common choice.

slides.title: Svelte Navigator Setup
slides.content:
# Setup üõ†Ô∏è

`npm install svelte-navigator`

Wrap your app in `<Router>`.

```html
<script>
  import { Router, Link, Route } from "svelte-navigator";
  import Home from "./Home.svelte";
</script>

<Router>
  <Route path="/" component={Home} />
</Router>
```

slides.title: Links
slides.content:
# Navigation üîó

Use the `<Link>` component to navigate without reloading.

```html
<nav>
  <Link to="/">Home</Link>
  <Link to="/about">About</Link>
</nav>
```

slides.title: Route Parameters
slides.content:
# Dynamic Routes üÜî

Define parameters using colon `:id`.

```html
<Route path="user/:id" component={UserProfile} />
```

Inside `UserProfile.svelte`, export the prop named `id`.

```javascript
export let id; // Automatically injected!
```

slides.content:
# Lazy Loading üí§

Use dynamic imports in standard Svelte components.

```html
{#await import('./Admin.svelte') then module}
  <svelte:component this={module.default} />
{/await}
```
Most routers support a simplified syntax for this.

slides.title: Page Transitions
slides.content:
# Animating Routes üï∫

Combine Routing with Svelte Transitions.

Wrap the route content in a `div` with `in:fade`.

(Note: This requires keying the router view to ensure the DOM elements are destroyed/recreated).

slides.title: SvelteKit Routing
slides.content:
# SvelteKit (Preview) üìÇ

If using SvelteKit (Framework):
- `src/routes/about.svelte` -> `/about`
- `src/routes/blog/[slug].svelte` -> `/blog/hello-world`

It handles SSR and CSR automatically.

slides.title: Summary
slides.content:
# Recap: Routing üéì

Navigation.

- **No Native Router:** Use `svelte-navigator` or `SvelteKit`.
- **Router:** Wraps the app.
- **Route:** Maps URL to Component.
- **Link:** `<a>` tag replacement.
- **Params:** Export `let id`.
